TopicTitle: RAPIER ENGINES - How To Tell Which Mode?

Articles.Content: Is there some what to tell which mode (air or closed) I'm in without right clicking the engine? I don't seem to see any visual or aural feedback of that - am I missing something?

Please mind where you post these threads: it does not belong in General Discussion.

Moved to Gameplay Questions.
The flames coming out the end should be (I believe) a different colour for different modes. You should be able to see a subtle difference.

Air Breathing has a red/orange exhaust. Rocket has a normal blue. You also can see the oxidizer depleting. -snip-

Edited December 17, 2013 by KasperVld

Air-breathing has a yellowish exhaust, Closed Cycle has a bluish-purplish exhaust. They also have slightly different sounds I think.

You could also check the resource panel to see if you are draining oxidiser.

Air-breathing has a yellowish exhaust, Closed Cycle has a bluish-purplish exhaust. They also have slightly different sounds I think.

You could also check the resource panel to see if you are draining oxidiser.

Thanks y'all
Also, if you right click it should tell you which mode you are in. (Either airbreathing or Fuel/LOX)
